messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Religion, again
messages.messageBody:
<<Heck,
I wouldn't want to mix with a group of White Separatist Movement
homeschoolers (should such a group exist).<<<>>

Found something:

A White Separatist "homeschool ciriculm"!!

This stuff is NOT about learning, it's about politics.
Learning about politics might be fun for some people, and some might not want
to even peek at this nastiness here, but here are some links. I haven't
looked at the "ciriculm" myself yet.

<<Sigrdrifa  awesome site with tons of great info on various topics like:
herbal remedies, a homeschool ciriculm with heritage in mind, canning and
preserving food, recipes, tons of great stuff for women to make their lives "more
natural". >>


There's something to surprise and offend everyone here. The main group is
called "Church of True Israel," and has waving confederate flags.

http://www.churchoftrueisrael.com/info/links.html


The spelling only reinforces the stereotype of ignorant southerners, but here
are some examples with which I did NOT tamper:

<<Modern History Sources  Modern(and acient) history layed out. If you
remember where these links are-THIS AND THE ONE ABOVE-your kids should do well in
history. >>

<<THE COVENANT VISION MINISTRY  Austrialian site >>

Hey, I found an Australian site yesterday (though they could spell
"Australia") looking for Christian Homeschooler-belief sites.

<<Cross Daily   Not Identity sort of a catch all (suposed to be) religous
site. Sorta Judeo Christian. Might come in handy for refrence. >>

Yeah. "Religous refrence" for proving white supremecy at all things but
spelling, maybe.

That page has lots more links "Avaiable"

<<White Womens Links

At Home Mothers  This is a "join" the group, but there is a lot of info and
articles FOR FREE

>>

This is a "'join' the group" must be secret code for something.

Then there are the KKK links.

These are not the Christian Homeschoolers I was talking about, but you know,
they're closer to them than I am.

Yet someone a day or two ago suggested that by me saying Christian
Homeschoolers existed, I was on the slippery slope toward becoming Hitler.

No, saying "some people are racist Nazis" is NOT what causes rifts and
divisions.
It's the people who have bunkered in with people of their own kind and
started spewing lies about people outside.

When liars and truthtellers are equated, someone's not being thoughtful or
fair.



Sandra
